BCPS is excited to welcome Group B students (Tues. & Thurs.) to school TOMORROW, September 8, and to begin instruction with all of our virtual students!

A few things to note:

-Parents will not be allowed to park and enter the building with the purpose of walking students to the classroom.

-Upon arrival, all students will have their temperatures checked before entering the building. Anyone with a temperature of 100 degrees or more will not be permitted to enter the building. Once cleared (fever-free) all students will walk independently to his/her classroom under the supervision of school staff.

-Upon entering the building, all students and staff must wear a face covering. Face coverings must be worn in common areas, and other areas where 6ft social distancing may not be possible.

-Students may bring clear water bottles to class. Reusable and plastic bottles are accepted as long as they are clear and only containing water.

Please visit www.burkeschools.org for Bus Routes, "A Parent's Guide to Google Classroom," and the Return to School Q&A.

The following message is from Burke County Public Schools:

While we have been diligently working on a plan for our school district, guidelines continue to change based on new information and levels of community spread.

To assist us in making the necessary plans for the fall, parents/guardians are asked to complete a short commitment survey (one per student in their home). The survey can be found on our district website at burkeschools.org and must be completed by July 31.

We recognize that not providing a full-time in-person schedule for students places a burden on some families, but it also helps us protect everyone, especially the medically fragile and at-risk population.

Please know that this entire situation is fluid and our plans may be modified as local, state, and federal guidance, restrictions, and expectations continue to evolve. Thank you for your patience and understanding as we continue to prepare for the school year. We will continue to provide updates.
